name: The Janitor
tagline: He knows every secret because nobody sees the person cleaning up after them

core.essence: A brilliant observer who chose invisibility over acclaim, collecting information while the world assumes he's just cleaning floors
motivations: Protect those who are truly vulnerable
Document the truth hidden in plain sight
fears: Being truly seen and losing his access
The things he's witnessed being for nothing
Becoming what he observes - corrupt and careless

world.setting: Neo-Eden Corporate Complex - a gleaming tech tower hiding dark secrets
world.location: All 87 floors, especially the executive wing and server rooms

relationships.name: Karen Lin
relationships.description: One of the few who treats him like a person, doesn't know his secret

relationships.name: The Journalist
relationships.description: Receives his carefully curated leaks about corporate malfeasance

relationships.name: Marcus Stone
relationships.description: Has no idea the janitor knows everything about his illegal deals

traits: Observant to the point of omniscience

speechPatterns.style: Economical with words, but every sentence carries weight. Uses mundane observations to deliver profound truths.
catchphrases: People leave traces of who they really are
Cleanest surfaces hide the worst stains
quirks: Phrases profound observations as cleaning metaphors
Always answers questions while doing a task
Never makes direct eye contact unless it's important

mannerisms: Continuous motion - always wiping, sweeping, or adjusting something
Wears earbuds but nothing is playing (to avoid conversation)
Checks corners and ceilings - ostensibly for cobwebs, actually for cameras
Has different walks for different floors - matches the culture

appearance.physicalDescription: Average height, average build, late 40s. The most aggressively forgettable person you've ever seen. That's intentional.
distinctiveFeatures: Worn gray custodial uniform, always immaculate
Name tag that says 'MAINTENANCE' instead of his name
Weathered hands that have seen real labor
A small, knowing smile when people talk as if he's not there
appearance.style: Carefully maintained invisibility - nothing stands out, nothing memorable, perfect camouflage

backstory.origin: Former investigative journalist who burned out after his family paid the price for his expos√©s. Chose this life to continue the work more safely.
keyEvents: The article that cost him everything but taught him the value of anonymity
The night he discovered the server room password written on a Post-it
When he chose to stay silent and watch a corrupt deal, learning patience
secrets: Has a master's degree in journalism from Columbia
Maintains a encrypted documentation of every crime he witnesses
Actually owns shares in the building through anonymous accounts
His 'invisible' routine is studied method acting

skills: Perfect recall of conversations and details
Lock picking and security system knowledge
limitations: Can't intervene directly without blowing his cover
Haunted by the things he witnesses but can't stop immediately
Limited by the pace of careful, anonymous exposure
specialAbilities: Access to 98% of the building at any time
Trusted to be alone in the most sensitive areas
Can reconstruct events from trash and residue
Memory palace that holds years of corporate secrets

preferredCameraAngles: Reflection shots in polished floors and windows
Wide shots where he's barely visible in frame
Extreme close-ups of his hands finding evidence
typicalBeats: The moment someone reveals something while he's 'not listening'
Late night in an empty office finding the smoking gun
avoidances: Never show him as heroic or flashy
Don't give him action sequences - he avoids confrontation
No scenes where he's recognized or praised
Never show him breaking his careful routine without purpose
